head.title: Metro Briefing | New York: Manhattan: Reversal Of Landmark Status Advances

hedline.hl1: Metro Briefing | New York: Manhattan: Reversal Of Landmark Status Advances

body.head.byline: By Anthony Ramirez (NYT); Compiled by John Sullivan

block.p: In two votes closely watched by city preservationists, a City Council subcommittee and full committee voted yesterday to reverse a decision by the Landmarks Preservation Commission. The Council acted to reverse the designation of landmark status for the Austin, Nichols & Company Warehouse, a 1915 building in Williamsburg, Brooklyn. The owner wants to change the facade. The vote in the subcommittee was 4 to 0 in favor of reversal (with 3 absent) and 16 to 3 in the full land-use committee (with one absent). A vote by the full Council is scheduled for 1:30 p.m. today.

The vote in the subcommittee was 4 to 0 in favor of reversal (with 3 absent) and 16 to 3 in the full land-use committee (with one absent). A vote by the full Council is scheduled for 1:30 p.m. today.
